title: Mohsin Naqvi vs India: Blow-by-blow account of ugly confrontations | Asia Cup final
content: The Asia Cup final was embroiled in controversy, with PCB chief Mohsin Naqvi at its center. Indian players refused to accept the winning trophy from him, causing significant delays and Naqvi walking off. This dramatic incident, marked by fan backlash, overshadowed India's ninth Asia Cup triumph.

title: PoK unrest: 1 killed, several injured in widespread protest; internet services blocked
content: One person was killed and several injured after Pakistan's security forces fired on protestors in PoK demonstrating over unresolved issues. A full-scale shutdown closed markets, while internet and phone services were suspended. Protests, joined by PTI, spread across districts, accusing the 'incompetent Anwar government' of repression.

title: 'Stolen from US': Trump announces tariffs on foreign films, furniture
content: Donald Trump announced plans for sweeping 100% tariffs on foreign-made movies, accusing other countries of stealing the US film industry. He also proposed substantial tariffs on imported furniture, citing losses in North Carolina. These protectionist measures aim to revive domestic industries, though implementation details remain unannounced.

title: Why did Suryakumar mimic Rohit after Asia Cup victory? Here's the unheard story
content: India secured a thrilling Asia Cup 2025 victory over Pakistan, but post-match celebrations were marred as ACC president Mohsin Naqvi withheld the trophy. Captain Suryakumar Yadav, guided by Arshdeep Singh, famously mimicked Rohit Sharma's iconic walk, creating a powerful symbolic moment. This spirited defiance marked India's ninth overall Asia Cup title amidst the unprecedented controversy, showcasing the team's resilience.

title: Accenture layoffs: 11,000 cut; CEO Julie Sweet says ‘we are exiting" employees we can't retrain
content: Accenture has laid off over 11,000 employees in the past three months, citing their inability to be retrained in AI skills, as it reshapes its workforce for the AI era. The company is simultaneously expanding its AI capabilities and plans to increase headcount, reflecting a broader industry trend of adapting to AI or facing obsolescence.

title: Asia Cup | Tharoor flags concerns after India's win: 'It is fair to ask a few questions'
content: Shashi Tharoor questioned Sanju Samson's batting position after India won the 2025 Asia Cup. He asked why Shubman Gill opened instead of Samson. Both players had modest performances in the tournament. Tharoor suggested restoring Samson to opener and placing Gill at number three. Samson contributed to stabilizing the innings during the final match.

title: EA to go private in $55 billion buyout: Silver Lake, PIF, and Affinity Partners lead deal;
content: Electronic Arts is set to go private in a $55 billion acquisition by Silver Lake, Saudi Arabia’s PIF, and Affinity Partners. This major leveraged buyout allows EA to restructure and innovate without public market pressures, aiming to strengthen its position amidst intense gaming competition. The move provides flexibility for long-term growth strategies.

title: Pakistan PUBG murders: Teen jailed 100 yrs for killing family; how game was involved
content: A Pakistani court sentenced 17-year-old Zain Ali to 100 years in prison for murdering his mother, brother, and two sisters. The violent outburst was linked to his obsession with the online game PUBG, occurring after he was scolded and missed an in-game target. Psychologists suggest potential underlying mental health issues.

title: 'When country's leader himself bats on the front foot': Surya on PM Modi's Op Sindoor post
content: India secured their ninth Asia Cup title by defeating Pakistan, prompting Prime Minister Modi's congratulatory message referencing Operation Sindoor. Captain Suryakumar Yadav praised Modi's support but downplayed an unusual trophy presentation where the team didn't receive the cup from the PCB Chairman. India also notably refused to shake hands with Pakistan following a terror attack.

title: H-1B visa policy change: Canada PM responds to Trump, says ‘maybe we can …’
content: President Trump's significant H-1B visa fee increase to $100,000 has created a stir, prompting Canada to consider attracting highly skilled professionals. Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney and industry experts view this as a "wonderful opportunity" to draw talent left stranded by the US policy, despite potential challenges within Canada's immigration system.

title: PM's 'Op Sindoor' post: Cong takes '3rd umpire' jab, says battlefield comparison not apt
content: PM Modi's congratulatory post for India's Asia Cup win, featuring "#OperationSindoor," ignited a political controversy. Congress leaders criticized the comparison of cricket to a battlefield and the politicization of sports. BJP, in turn, slammed Congress for its silence on India's victory, escalating the political back-and-forth.

title: Rory McIlroy net worth 2025: career, earnings, Masters win, Ryder Cup glory
content: Rory McIlroy had a historic 2025, winning The Masters to complete his career grand slam and also securing the Players Championship. He led Team Europe to a Ryder Cup victory, boosting his net worth to $250 million. Despite a Ryder Cup incident, his leadership and bold play defined his powerful year.

title: 'Marwaa diya': Haris Rauf gets brutal treatment from Pak legends | Asia Cup final
content: Former Pakistani cricketers have sharply criticised Haris Rauf’s costly performance in the Asia Cup final against India, where he conceded 50 runs in four overs. Veterans questioned his death-over bowling and captain Salman Ali Agha’s decision to bring him on during a crucial phase, which ultimately shifted momentum firmly towards India.

title: Watch: Naqvi runs away with trophy; IPL team trolls PCB chief
content: India celebrated their Asia Cup 2025 victory over Pakistan but refused to accept the trophy from ACC president Mohsin Naqvi, an interim Pakistani minister. This decision stemmed from strained diplomatic relations following a terrorist attack. The BCCI plans to lodge a strong protest against Naqvi's actions at an upcoming ICC conference.

title: Prashant Kishore's explosive claim: Big 'murder' charge on deputy CM Samrat Choudhary
content: Jan Suraaj founder Prashant Kishor accused Bihar deputy CM Samrat Choudhary of involvement in a 1995 murder case, alleging he used forged documents to claim minority status. Kishor demanded Choudhary's immediate arrest and removal from office, highlighting a contradiction in his age declarations. He threatened legal action if authorities fail to intervene.

title: Leanna Lenee celebrates Jaguars’ Week 4 win with viral four-word Instagram post
content: Jacksonville Jaguars rookie Travis Hunter, the 2024 Heisman winner, contributed on both offense and defense in their 26-21 victory over the 49ers. His wife, Leanna Lenee, celebrated his effort and the team's win with a viral social media post. Hunter's dual-threat talent continues to be a unique storyline in his promising rookie season.

title: World's highest bridge opens to traffic in China
content: China inaugurated the world's highest bridge, the Huajiang Grand Canyon Bridge, towering 2,051 feet above a river in Guizhou province. Concurrently, Polish skier Andrzej Bargiel achieved a historic first by climbing and skiing down Mount Everest without supplemental oxygen, a remarkable feat given the extreme conditions at high altitude.

title: Abhishek, Gill's unseen celebration in luxury car - how much is it worth?
content: Indian cricketers Shubman Gill and Abhishek Sharma celebrated India's thrilling Asia Cup victory over Pakistan by taking a joyous spin in Abhishek's new car, a reward for his Player of the Tournament award. Their heartwarming camaraderie highlighted India's ninth Asia Cup crown, secured by Tilak Varma's match-winning knock in a tense chase against their arch-rivals.

title: Why Kash Patel's handshake with Pak Army Chief infuriated desis
content: President Donald Trump hosted Pakistani Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif and Field Marshal Asim Munir at the White House last week. Among the senior American officials present was FBI Director Kash Patel. While Trump’s hospitality for Pakistan’s leadership was expected, the image of Patel — Indian-origin, Hindu, and a vocal defender of the Ram Mandir — warmly greeting Munir struck a raw nerve. The photo went viral, spawning accusations of betrayal, opportunism, and hypocrisy.

title: Robert Quinn faces December trial after arrest video shows ex-NFL star
content: Former NFL star Robert Quinn faced arrest in North Charleston. Police bodycam footage shows him injured and confused. He allegedly backed his truck into a car and tried to leave. Officers charged him with reckless driving and property damage. This follows a 2023 hit-and-run case. Quinn's trial is set for December 2025. His off-field struggles now overshadow his football career.

title: Dubai’s richest man has $17.1 bn net worth - He’s not a Sheikh or Prince
content: Pavel Durov, the Russian-born tech entrepreneur behind Telegram, is Dubai's richest man with a $17.1 billion net worth. He settled in Dubai for its tax-friendly policies after leaving Russia over data privacy. Recently, Durov accused French intelligence of pressuring him to censor Moldovan channels, adding to his controversial public image amidst ongoing legal issues in France.

title: Asia Cup | 'Dube has never copied Yuvraj Singh': Coach
content: Shivam Dube's crucial 33 not out and economical bowling in the Asia Cup final against Pakistan drew accolades from his former coach, Satish Samant. Samant praised Dube's journey, natural six-hitting ability, and dedication, attributing his success to hard work and the team management's unwavering faith. Dube's vital contribution filled the void left by Hardik Pandya's absence.

title: Asia Cup final: Trophy drama, Virat Kohli chants, and post-match chaos – full timeline
content: The Asia Cup 2025 final between India and Pakistan was marred by unprecedented controversy. India refused the trophy from PCB chief Mohsin Naqvi, who then walked off with it. Pakistan captain Salman Ali Agha also threw away the runners-up cheque, making it a chaotic and unforgettable night.

title: 'Outlook stable': Moody's retains India credit rating at 'Baa3'; here's what it said
content: Moody's retained India's Baa3 rating with a stable outlook, citing a robust economy and strong external standing despite US tariffs. The stable outlook and rating confirmation indicate India's continuing credit advantages.

title: 'Oye Raju da munda': Shubman Gill turns cheerleader for friend Abhishek Sharma - Watch
content: Abhishek Sharma was crowned Player of the Tournament at the Men’s T20 Asia Cup 2025, driving India to their title triumph against Pakistan. The opener amassed 314 runs in seven matches at a blazing strike rate of 200, consistently providing explosive starts. His impactful performances earned him a brand-new car and widespread acclaim, with teammate Shubman Gill celebrating his success.

title: Kurur stampede: NDA forms 8-member fact-finding team; Hema Malini to lead delegation
content: The BJP constituted an 8-member delegation, led by Hema Malini, to visit Karur, Tamil Nadu, following a deadly stampede at a TVK rally that killed 41 people due to overcrowding. The delegation will investigate the incident's circumstances, meet affected families, and submit a report on the tragedy.

title: Taylor Swift’s dad shines at Chiefs vs Ravens while repping Travis Kelce’s brand
content: Taylor Swift's father, Scott Swift, captured attention by proudly wearing Travis Kelce’s Tru Kolors hat during the Kansas City Chiefs' 37-20 victory over the Baltimore Ravens, signaling strong family support. Taylor herself made a discreet return to Arrowhead after attending Selena Gomez's wedding, quietly supporting Kelce while avoiding the spotlight. This commanding win marked a significant turnaround for the Chiefs.

title: Karnataka: Veteran theatre artist Yashwant Sardeshpande passes away at 60
content: Veteran theatre artist and playwright Yashwant Sardeshpande, 60, passed away on Monday morning due to a severe heart attack, causing widespread sorrow. A renowned Kannada theatre actor and popular playwright, he was known for acting and directing numerous plays, including the successful "All the Best," and also appeared in television and films.

title: How Mohsin Naqvi's actions added to India vs Pakistan controversies in Asia Cup
content: ACC President Mohsin Naqvi ignited a major controversy after the Indian team refused to accept the Asia Cup trophy from him, citing his anti-India stance. Naqvi subsequently left with the trophy, denying India their traditional celebration. This incident follows his provocative social media posts and PCB's earlier threats to withdraw from the tournament, escalating tensions.

title: UAE just launched 4 new visit visas for AI, cruise, events, and entertainment
content: The UAE introduced new visa categories on September 29, 2025, to attract global talent and support vulnerable groups. Specialized visas for AI professionals, cruise industry workers, event participants, and entertainment specialists aim to boost key sectors. Additionally, humanitarian residency permits now offer stability for foreign widows and divorcees of UAE nationals.

title: Top 10 countries of birth for approved H-1B visas in FY 2024, India leading
content: In Fiscal Year 2024, the H-1B visa program approved nearly 400,000 petitions, with India overwhelmingly dominating as the source country, accounting for 71% of beneficiaries. China followed with 11.7%, while other nations like the Philippines, Canada, and South Korea contributed smaller percentages. This highlights India's significant role in supplying skilled professionals to the US workforce.

title: 'Victims are our brothers, sisters': Stalin condoles Karur deaths; cautions against rumours
content: Tamil Nadu CM M.K. Stalin announced a one-member inquiry commission, led by former judge Arunachalam Jagadeesan, into the Karur stampede that claimed 41 lives. He disbursed Rs 10 lakh to each bereaved family and urged against social media rumours. Stalin stressed collective responsibility to prevent future tragedies, prioritizing human lives, and plans to frame rules for events.

title: Karur tragedy: Stampede 'engineered' by police & DMK's Senthil Balaji, says TVK
content: TVK General Secretary Aadhav Arjuna moved the Madras High Court, seeking a CBI probe into the Karur stampede during Vijay's rally. He alleged police and ruling DMK members engineered the incident through electricity disruptions and inadequate arrangements. The petition, which also sought to allow visits to victims' families, was subsequently refused by the high court registry.

title: Manipur unrest fallout: Displaced boy ends life at Jiribam camp
content: A 13-year-old boy, displaced by Manipur's ethnic violence, died by suicide at a Jiribam relief camp, renewing grave concerns for internally displaced persons. This incident brings the reported IDP suicides to at least six since May 2023, underscoring the severe mental health crisis. Authorities have initiated an investigation into the tragic death.

title: 'I am Baramati’s best MLA but Saheb’s record unmatched'; Ajit hails uncle Sharad Pawar
content: Deputy CM Ajit Pawar reflected on his political journey, acknowledging comparisons to Sharad Pawar while highlighting his own dedication as Baramati MLA. He sternly directed police to implement MCOCA against goons at the APMC market, irrespective of their political ties, condemning criminal behaviour. Pawar further rejected attempts to communalize incidents, advocating for secular values and unity.

title: 'Champion team denied trophy': How PCB's Mohsin Naqvi ran away with Asia Cup silverware
content: India’s Asia Cup 2025 victory over Pakistan turned chaotic off the field, with PCB chief Mohsin Naqvi reportedly taking the trophy and medals after the Indian team refused to receive them from him. The Indian players celebrated with an imaginary trophy, while Suryakumar Yadav and Abhishek Sharma publicly criticised the ACC in the post-match press conference.

title: Moldova elections: Zelenskyy hails Maia Sandu's victory; calls out Russia's 'destabilising activity'
content: Ukraine's President Zelenskyy hailed the pro-European Union party's victory in Moldova's election, asserting that Russian destabilizing efforts and disinformation failed. President Maia Sandu's party secured over 50% of the vote, a crucial outcome for the nation's EU integration push. This result demonstrates Moldova's successful defense against external threats.

title: Silver price today: White metal hits lifetime high; here's what's driving the rally
content: Gold and silver prices soared to lifetime highs in the domestic futures market, mirroring a robust international rally. This surge is primarily driven by growing expectations of US Federal Reserve rate cuts and a weakening dollar, significantly boosting demand for precious metals. Ongoing geopolitical tensions, including trade disputes and conflicts, are also contributing factors.

title: UP cleric rapes, impregnates 14-year-old madrassa student; held
content: A 14-year-old girl was allegedly repeatedly raped and impregnated by a 32-year-old cleric inside a Saharanpur madrassa over several months. The horrific abuse surfaced when she complained of abdominal pain. Police have arrested the accused, who reportedly threatened the victim. Authorities are now investigating his family's involvement and questioning other students, with the cleric's brother currently absconding.

title: Man shoots teen daughter over inter-caste love; dumps body in tarpaulin bag in river
content: A man was arrested in Morena for allegedly killing his 17-year-old daughter. He reportedly opposed her marriage outside their caste. Police found the body in a river after a neighbour's tip-off. Separately, the Karnataka High Court denied bail to a rape accused. The court cited Manusmriti and Mahatma Gandhi in its decision.

title: Best, worst of NFL Week 4: Packers tie Cowboys in OT thriller, plus Chiefs win big over Ravens
content: Our NFL Nation reporters react to all the action, answering the biggest questions coming out of each game. Here's what we learned from Week 4.

title: Jackson injures hamstring as Ravens fall to 1-3
content: Ravens quarterback Lamar Jackson sustained a hamstring injury in the third quarter of his team's 37-20 loss to the Kansas City Chiefs on Sunday at Arrowhead Stadium, and Baltimore coach John Harbaugh had no update during his postgame media availability.

title: Parsons leaves Dallas 'disappointed' in defense, tie
content: Micah Parsons got one thing he wanted in his return to AT&T Stadium: He sacked his former QB, Dak Prescott. The rest of it, however, left him unfulfilled after his current team, the Packers, played his former team, the Cowboys, to a 40-40 tie Sunday.

title: Coen, Saleh clash postgame over sign-stealing talk
content: The simmering tension over 49ers DC Robert Saleh's remark about the Jaguars "legally stealing signals" from opponents spilled onto the field Sunday, as Saleh and Jacksonville coach Liam Coen had to be separated amid a heated postgame exchange.

title: Sources: Petrino overhauls staff, fires assistants
content: Bobby Petrino started overhauling his coaching staff at Arkansas on Monday, sources told ESPN, firing three defensive assistants.

title: Mercury top short-handed Lynx, make WNBA Finals
content: The Phoenix Mercury overcame a 13-point fourth-quarter deficit to defeat the short-handed Minnesota Lynx 86-81 in Game 4 on Sunday to advance to the WNBA Finals for the first time since 2021, and in that round, they'll take on Indiana or Las Vegas.

title: Ryder Cup envelope rule must change, per Bradley
content: U.S. captain Keegan Bradley said the Ryder Cup's longstanding envelope rule involving injured players should change, but European counterpart Luke Donald said it's there to protect players and should remain in place.

title: Mets fumble final shot at October: 'It's a failure'
content: The Mets, who entered the season with a $322.6 million payroll and huge expectations, completed their monthslong collapse Sunday with a loss to Miami.

title: Rory: Should never accept fans' behavior in N.Y.
content: Rory McIlroy, the target of constant heckling this week at Bethpage Black, called the fans' behavior unacceptable and said Americans should have been supporting their own players, not using that energy to insult the Europeans.

title: MLB playoffs preview: World Series odds, why every team could win -- and fatal flaws for all 12 teams
content: Have Fall Classic or bust hopes for the postseason? Here's why your squad could be playing deep into October ... or get sent home early.

title: How Phoenix reached the WNBA Finals, Indiana forced semifinals Game 5
content: Phoenix is headed to the WNBA Finals. The Fever forced the Aces to a Game 5. We break down Sunday's games.

title: Oregon in OT? Virginia's stunner? Bama's redemption? Ranking best games of Week 5﻿﻿
content: The heavyweight battles brought the goods, but there were even more thrillers. We rank Week 5's games.

title: Can the Ravens right their 1-3 ship? Barnwell breaks down their two biggest issues that need fixing
content: Baltimore came into the season with Super Bowl hopes but is now 1-3. What happened, and can the Ravens turn things around before it's too late?

title: Who's the best movie fighter ever? MMA experts weigh in
content: ESPN assembled a panel of MMA experts to determine which Hollywood stars would win a UFC-style event.

title: How Europe was able to back up Rory McIlroy's words and win on the road
content: Two years ago, McIlroy predicted a win at Bethpage. Europe's gutsy team play made that prediction come true.

title: Grading 50-plus NBA deals, including Al Horford's deal with Warriors
content: Kevin Pelton breaks down the most impactful signings, including the Clippers bringing back Chris Paul.

title: Caitlin Clark fuels women's memorabilia market growth
content: Sports collectibles industry experts say interest in Caitlin Clark cards is leading to growth in the women's memorabilia market overall, particularly for the WNBA.

title: 'I'm going to get Dan back': Aaron Glenn ready to add to legacy in Jets-Dolphins rivalry
content: The Jets' coach was drafted by the franchise in 1994 and had a role in several key moments and games against the Dolphins.

title: Why a return to Miami means so much for Minkah Fitzpatrick
content: The trade to the Dolphins has allowed the safety to spend time with family, including a budding football star.

title: 'It's best against best': Ja'Marr Chase, Pat Surtain II ready for rare battle of WR, CB elites
content: Chase, the reigning Offensive Player of the Year, and Surtain, the defending DPOY, face off in an epic WR/CB battle.

title: 10 moments that define 2025 Mets' epic collapse
content: The Mets nearly won a pennant last year -- and then added Juan Soto. And yet a season of promise turned into an all-time collapse.

title: Ranking the top freshmen so far in the 2025 college football season
content: Through five weeks, we've seen first-year players make huge contributions. These 11 players are standing out.

title: Buzz: Nabers feared out for season, Jackson hurt, Addison returns, Hampton emerges
content: Malik Nabers injury overshadowed everything on Sunday but there were plenty of fantasy takeaways to be had.

title: Atlético Madrid serve up derby lesson, Liverpool get a wake-up call and more
content: Atletico Madrid turned back the clock to thrash their rivals in a game that will give both sides plenty to think about. Plus: Arsenal get a big win and Liverpool a wake-up call, as Gab Marcotti explains the weekend.

title: Ruben Amorim running out of excuses: The numbers don't lie
content: Soccer management is ultimately a numbers game, and none of them are adding up for Man United's manager.

title: Who will make the 12-team College Football Playoff?
content: Select your favorite contender, make your picks for how its season will play out and see what the Allstate Playoff Predictor foretells.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Xavi keen on Man United if Amorim departs
content: Xavi would be interested in joining Manchester United if they choose to replace beleaguered boss Ruben Amorim. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Mysuru gears up for Jamboo Savari finale amid heavy traffic
content: A mock exercise of mounting the golden howdah on Abhimanyu was performed near the palace residence of the royal family. As part of the rehearsal, flower petals were showered on the elephants

title: Municipality and Panchayat Raj amendment Bills referred to Subject Committee
content: Aimed at bringing in an internal vigilance system as well as more clarity in the reservation of seats for Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes in local bodies

title: 27 rehabilitation centres set up for families affected by Krishna floods in Bapatla district
content: 5,783 families, comprising 14,391 people from 27 habitations, identified for relocation; Collector assures residents that officials would remain stationed at the centres round-the-clock to address their needs

title: No talks till normalcy restored in Ladakh: Leh Apex Body
content: After nearly four months of stalled talks, the Centre had on September 20 extended an invitation to the LAB and Kargil Democratic Alliance, which have been spearheading the agitation for statehood and extension of the Sixth Schedule to the Union Territory

title: Youth Congress workers take out march seeking resumption of road works
content: They demand govt. steps for resumption of works on the Neryamangalam-Valara stretch of the Kochi-Dhanushkodi National Highway

title: Rainfall subsides but water-levels high in Krishna, tributaries in North Karnataka
content: Some bridge-cum-barrages remain submerged; 321 houses suffer damage, onion crop destroyed in Bagalkot district

title: Residents air grievances about human-elephant conflict at workshop in Hassan
content: The plantation workers had to work in fear as they could encounter the wild animal at any time, while parents were worried about the safety of their children

title: Ruling LDF, Opposition UDF spar in Assembly over state of Kerala finances
content: The Opposition accuses LDF government of miserably failing in fiscal management. Finance Minister K.N. Balagopal counters the charge saying that economic activities are progressing smoothly despite the squeeze caused by unfriendly Central policies

title: Udan Yatri Cafes will be opened at airports across India in phased manner, says Union Minister
content: Flight to Singapore from Vijayawada will commence soon, New Integrated Terminal Building will be completed in three months, announces Rammohan Naidu

title: NSS-SNDP bonhomie poses test for Congress ahead of elections
content: The IUML and the Kerala Congress openly expressed their dissatisfaction over the widening gap between the Congress and the community organisations.

title: Shipwreck: Steps taken to recover compensation from shipping company, says Kerala Fisheries Minister
content: The National Institute of Oceanography has been asked to conduct a study to assess the environmental damage caused by the shipwreck and to conduct a long-term study, says Saji Cherian in Assembly

title: Traffic diversions in Hyderabad for Saddula Bathukamma celebrations on September 30
content: Traffic congestion is likely at VV Statue in Khairatabad, Old Saifabad Police Station, Iqbal Minar, Telugu Thalli junction, Necklace Rotary, Liberty, Ravindra Bharati, Ambedkar Statue, Tank Bund, Kawadiguda crossroads, Katta Maisamma, Karbala Maidan, Ranigunj and Nallagutta

title: Chhota Bheem-themed cafe set to debut in Hyderabad by December
content: The project will gradually expand across the country, with 50 more outlets targeted for 2026, before moving to international markets

title: Watch: Leh shut down after protests: tourists stranded, hotels empty
content: Leh, the capital of Ladakh, is witnessing a tourism crisis following violent protests over statehood demands. A strict curfew, internet shutdown, and closed markets have left tourists stranded and hotel bookings cancelled. Local livelihoods are suffering amid the unrest. Hear from tourists and hotel staff about the current ground situation.

title: Tourism, livestock grazing impact gut microbiome of tigers, finds CCMB study
content: Disruptions to this microbial balance — known as gut dysbiosis — can have long-term impact on digestion, immunity and disease resistance, according to researchers

title: Situation continues to be grim in villages on the banks of the Bhima
content: Except for slight showers in very a few parts, the district hasn’t received significant rainfall in the 24-hour period ended at 8.30 a.m. on Monday

title: Canada lists Lawrence Bishnoi gang as terrorist entity
content: Canada’s Public Safety Minister says specific communities have been targeted for terror, violence and intimidation by the Bishnoi gang

title: Rising heart risk among Gen-Z and students in focus on World Heart Day
content: Doctors noted that college students and young professionals are increasingly presenting with cardiac problems linked to stress, poor diet, sedentary lifestyle and undetected risk factors

title: Indian Immunologicals rolls out India’s first gE deleted DIVA marker vaccine against IBR
content: Infectious bovine rhinotracheitis is a major concern for dairy industry, with incidence levels above 32% and economic losses estimated at ₹18,000 crore annually

title: Elders can cancel property gift deed to family if not treated with love, affection: Delhi HC
content: A bench of Chief Justice Devendra Kumar Upadhyaya and Justice Tushar Rao Gedela gave the ruling while hearing the plea of an 88-year-old woman who had gifted her property to her daughter-in-law in 2015

title: Mysuru-based IT company launches AI-powered toolkit for teachers aimed at reducing classroom preparation time
content: The toolkit addresses one of the biggest gaps in India’s classrooms: the disproportionate time teachers spend on preparation versus direct student engagement

title: Andhra Pradesh Ministers meet LG Chemicals, ShoeallS, SK Hynix executives in Seoul to boost investments
content: P. Narayana and B.C. Janardhan Reddy hold discussions with South Korean industry leaders, inviting them to explore investment opportunities in Andhra Pradesh and participate in the CII Partnership Summit in Visakhapatnam on November 14–15

title: Higher Education Minister R. Bindu allays concerns about validity of three-year degrees
content: Such degrees will be considered valid for all purposes where a regular degree is required, including for PSC, BEd and LLB.

title: Iranian-Origin Families In Bihar Fight Poll List Revision Battle
content: Two generations after families of Iranian descent settled in Bihar's Kishanganj, dozens now face notices to prove their citizenship under the ongoing Special Intensive Revision exercise ahead of the Bihar Assembly polls.

title: Will Recommend CBI Probe Into Alleged Paper Leak: Uttarakhand Chief Minister
content: Uttarakhand Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami on Monday met the youths protesting at the Parade Ground here against the alleged paper leak in a graduate level examination last week and assured them that the state will recommend a CBI probe.

title: Greed Over Love? UP Man Murders Family For Insurance Money
content: A disturbing case has emerged from the state of Uttar Pradesh, where a man claimed crores of rupees from multiple insurance companies by falsely claiming the deaths of his parents and his wife as road accidents.

title: 6-Year-Old Dies After Being Hit By Tractor In UP's Chandauli: Cops
content: A six-year-old boy died after being hit by a tractor in this Uttar Pradesh district on Monday, after the driver lost control of the vehicle when one of its tyres burst, police said.

title: "Break Barriers With Hard Work": Gujarat Governor At Adani Vidya Mandir
content: Gujarat Governor Acharya Devvrat on Monday urged students at the Adani Vidya Mandir (AVM) here to embrace hard work, discipline and freedom from vices as the true path to success and called on them to live with simplicity and responsibility.

title: Bengaluru Student, 22, On Scooty Run Over While Trying To Avoid Pothole
content: In yet another pothole-related incident in Bengaluru, a 22-year-old student was killed after she came under the wheels of a tipper truck while trying to avoid a pothole in North Bengaluru's Avalahalli area on Monday.

title: Piracy Racket Causing Rs 3,700-Crore Loss To Telugu Film Industry, Busted
content: A sophisticated, multi-state movie piracy racket has been busted with the arrest of five men allegedly responsible for leaking high-profile films and causing estimated losses of Rs 3,700 crore to the Telugu film industry.

title: "Went To See Actor Vijay, But Lost My Friend": Man Injured In Tamil Nadu Stampede
content: A man who had gone to TVK chief Vijay's rally in Tamil Nadu's Karur on Saturday because he wanted to catch a glimpse of the actor was among 41 people who were killed in the stampede.

title: "I Was Lucky": Woman Reveals How She Avoided Delhi Sleaze Baba's Ashram
content: A young woman who narrowly avoided getting admission at self-styled godman Chaitanyananda Saraswati, now under arrest for alleged sexual harassment and intimidation of students, has come forward with her account.

title: Parents In Other Room, Trainee Doctor Jumps From 21st Floor In Greater Noida
content: A trainee doctor allegedly died by suicide by jumping from the 21st floor of a building in Uttar Pradesh's Greater Noida.

title: Ex-DUSU President Ronak Khatri Alleges Rs 5 Crore Extortion Threat By Rohit Godara Gang
content: Former Delhi University Students' Union (DUSU) president Ronak Khatri on Monday lodged a complaint with Delhi Police, alleging that he had received a threat call demanding Rs 5 crore from an international number.

title: Maharashtra Man Dies By Suicide, Blames Family In Video: Cops
content: A 32-year-old man from Palghar in Maharashtra allegedly committed suicide after recording a video in which he accused his wife, in-laws and his own father of persistent harassment, police said on Monday.

title: This Ancient Temple In Bihar Practices Rare Bloodless Sacrifice
content: The ancient Maa Mundeshwari Temple in Kaimur district of Bihar is known for its unique tradition of bloodless sacrifice.

title: BJP MP Had Questioned Jan Suraaj's Funding. Prashant Kishor Responds
content: Days after a BJP leader questioned Jan Suraaj's funding, its leader and poll strategist-turned-politician, Prashant Kishor, has shared details and stressed that the party's funding is transparent and clean

title: 'I Love Mohammed' On Rangoli Sparks Tension In Maharashtra, 30 Detained
content: Tension grips Ahilyanagar in Maharashtra after the "I love Mohammed" slogan written in a rangoli on the street sparked communal tension, and a group of protesters clashed with the police

title: Opinion: Opinion | Can India Rescue Its Exiled Coders - Like China And Taiwan?
content: For years, the middle-class mantra in India was: study hard, crack the exams, get the H-1B visa, build a life in America. That promise now lies in ruins. But...China and Taiwan have been here before.

title: Day Before Son's 18th Birthday, Delhi Man Makes Him Murder Property Dealer
content: The police said the 47-year-old accused deliberately carried out the crime just a day before the 18th birthday of his son so he could benefit from the provisions of juvenile law.

title: Bengaluru Man Makes Objectionable Remarks Against Woman Cop, Case Filed
content: Karnataka Police has registered a case against a bike rider for making objectionable remarks on social media against a woman Traffic Police Sub-Inspector (PSI) in Bengaluru.

title: Supreme Court orders training for Delhi judges over ‘perverse’ bail order in ₹1.9-crore fraud case
content: Bench finds that the judges have disregarded binding precedents and “glossed over” material facts while releasing the accused

title: KSRTC says Dasara special fares on Bengaluru–Mysuru route in place for 20 years
content: Officials explained that the hike applies only to specific days, as permitted under Karnataka government notification, which allows fare revision during special events, fairs, and holidays

title: Watch: Karur rally stampede: What really happened that night
content: On 27 September, actor and TVK leader Vijay’s political rally in Velusamypuram, Karur, turned into one of Tamil Nadu’s worst stampedes in recent memory. Delays, overcrowding, and collapsing rooftops left at least 41 people, including women and children, dead.

title: Reservation is necessary as long as inequality continues in society: Nagamohan Das
content: ‘There is a misconception among many people that the constitution framers limiting the reservation policy for only 10 years. However, the restriction was only for political representation, not for educational and employment purposes’

title: Sidhu Moosewala’s father says he wants to contest next Assembly poll from Mansa
content: Addressing a gathering during a Congress party programme in Mansa on Sunday, Mr. Balkaur Singh said that people of Mansa gave him strength after he lost his son and they continue to stand behind the family

title: Delhi HC restrains Rupa Publications from publishing red-and-black edition of Constitution
content: The court said Rupa Publications had adopted a colour scheme, text and font, gilt edging, book posteen colour, and embossed gold detailing, all similar to the Constitution published by the petitioner, Eastern Book Company. It could mislead an ‘unwary consumer’ regarding the source or origin of the said products, it said.

title: Tenant farmers demand immediate completion of e-crop registration for temple lands
content: Without e-crop registration, farmers cultivating temple lands will not be eligible for fertilizers, pesticides, crop insurance, or compensation in case of crop failure, say leaders

title: Cyberabad Police intensify crackdown on illegal foreigners, 23 deported so far
content: House owners renting accommodation to foreigners directed to verify documents before letting out rooms and to re-check details of current tenants

title: Bareilly violence: Internet suspension extended
content: On Friday (September 26), police and locals clashed in the heart of the city over denial of permission for a demonstration in support of the ongoing 'I Love Muhammad' campaign

title: Farmers seek fair and remunerative price for sugarcane
content: The protesting farmers demanded that FRP should be fixed at ₹4,000 a tonne, given the increase in cost of cultivation

title: A.P. leaders hail Team India, Tilak Varma after Asia Cup 2025 victory
content: Chief Minister calls it as a glorious moment for Indian cricket and lauds the Telugu cricketer for playing a match-winning innings with remarkable composure in the final against Pakistan

title: Andhra Pradesh BJP president accuses YSR family of hostility towards Hindu temples
content: P.V.N. Madhav demands a public apology from Congress leaders over Y.S. Sharmila’s remarks on temple construction, alleging repeated attempts to undermine Hindu faith

title: Commandos will guard Dasara elephants to keep the crowd at bay: Forest Minister Khandre
content: There is an increase in the number of people making reels or photos by holding elephant trunks or tusks and posting them online, Minister Khandre

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: Chief Minister Siddaramaiah slams BJP’s ‘double standard’ on Social and Educational Survey in Karnataka
content: This is not against anyone, it is for everyone. The purpose is to ensure social, economic, and educational equality by giving equal share and opportunities to all, says CM

title: Elapully grama panchayat in Palakkad to move Kerala High Court against State govt.
content: The government had approved Oasis Commercial Pvt. Ltd.’s brewery project in the panchayat without consulting it, sparking widespread protests against the proposal

title: Allegations work of powerful lobby hit by ethanol blending of petrol: Nitin Gadkari
content: "About ₹22 lakh crore were going out of the country owing to imports of fossil fuels. Their businesses got affected and they got angry and started paid news against me," Nitin Gadkari said

title: Former DUSU president Ronak Khatri alleges extortion threat, files police complaint
content: The caller allegedly claimed association with the Rohit Godara gang and threatened to kill him if the money is not paid, said DUSU president Ronak Khatri

title: Warfare now measured in hours and seconds, not months: Rajnath at ICG conference
content: Rajnath Singh also underlined that cyber and electronic warfare are "no longer hypothetical threats", but present-day realities

title: Bomb threat to Ahmedabad airport found hoax; police register FIR
content: Upon learning about the email, airport officials immediately convened an online meeting of the “bomb threat committee” and came to the conclusion that it was a “non-specific bomb threat”, the FIR stated

title: Swiggy partners with Tourism Western Australia
content: The collaboration is aimed at creating awareness amongst Indian travellers to explore Western Australia as their next holiday destination.

title: KDA demands unconditional release of Wangchuk, says Centre ‘alienating’ people of Ladakh
content: Kargil Democratic Alliance demands release of detained activist and other youth leaders in Leh and says the demands for statehood and constitutional safeguards under the Sixth Schedule are “not negotiable”

title: Government contemplates amendment to Kerala Money-Lenders’ Act
content: To deal more seriously with the crime of people pawning  fake gold. Act to be amended to enable the confiscation of assets of the person pawning fake gold to recover the losses suffered by the  financial institution

title: CCB arrests three Sri Lankan nationals overstaying illegally in Bengaluru
content: The accused, suspected to be part of international drug syndicate, had escaped from the enforcement authority in Jaffna and reached India by boat.

title: Punjab Assembly passes resolution against Centre's 'lack of response' on financial package
content: “This House categorically condemns the lack of response and the failure of the BJP-led union government to sanction a special financial package commensurate with the scale of the worst floods faced by Punjab in decades,” the resolution passed by the Punjab Assembly said

title: Kerala’s first government-run home for bedridden elderly offers dignity and care
content: At Santhwanatheeram in Arattupuzha grama panchayat in Alappuzha, elderly residents sing, share memories, and find companionship in the twilight of their lives

title: Watch: Karur stampede: family of youngest victim speaks out
content: A tragic stampede at actor Vijay’s TVK rally in Karur claimed over 40 lives, including the youngest victim, Thuruvishnu, a 1-year-10-month-old toddler. His grieving family recalls the chaos, overcrowding, and power outage that made rescue impossible.

title: NDA delegation to look into Karur stampede tragedy
content: Constituted by BJP chief J.P. Nadda, the delegation will look into the circumstances that led to the incident, meet with families, and submit a report

title: Officials in Mandya questioned about lack of water in lakes despite KRS reservoir filled to capacity
content: Some lakes remain unfilled despite KRS reservoir being full, says district in-charge secretary Manoj Kumar Meena

title: 'Love should be in hearts, not streets': All India Muslim Jamaat chief urges peace in Bareilly

title: MLB wild-card round odds: The favorites for every series
content: the 2025 MLB playoffs kick off with the wild-card round . make your picks The two division winners in each league with the best records get a chance to rest their regulars and set up their rotations . each team's odds to win the series are accurate as of publish time .

title: No talks till normalcy restored in Ladakh, Leh Apex Body tells govt
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .

title: Giants are cursed, Titans destined for another top pick? Overreacting to Week 4
content: the Falcons racked up 435 total yards in a 34-27 victory over the -less Commanders . a second-year QB Michael Penix Jr. followed the worst game of his young career with his best . the two teams fought valiantly against the Commanders and Marcus Mariota .

title: 🪫Giants' jab at Chargers leads Week 4 trolls
content: the new york Giants beat the Los Angeles Chargers 21-18 at home . the Giants posted a photo of a broken phone charger with the caption: "low power mode" the Seattle Seahawks beat the Arizona Cardinals on "Thursday night football"

title: This year was supposed to be a Dodgers coronation; instead, it's an October crapshoot
content: the defending world Series champions had emerged from free agency with the best starter on the market, the best reliever on the marketplace and the best pitching prospect in the world . they were bound to be an all-time juggernaut, top to bottom, eons beyond any of their competitors . it wasn't 117, even if the number to set the game's single-game rotation was 117.

title: LeBron's future, Celtics' goals sans Tatum: Biggest question for all 30 teams
content: despite 22 days separating the preseason from opening night, not every team's offseason storylines have been resolved . how will the saga trickle into the Golden State Warriors ' season; how the LA Clippers will handle the league's investigation into Kawhi Leonard . what are the expectations for the Indiana Pacers this season are just some of the largest stories to follow .

title: Power Rankings: LSU drops 13 spots; BYU, Memphis and Louisville join the Top 25
content: the first full month of the 2025 college football season is officially in the books . some of the nation's biggest early-season surprises were once again on display . despite a leaky run defense, Alabama notched its latest win over Georgia on the road .

title: Ranking winners and losers, injury impacts from Sunday
content: RB, Las Vegas Raiders : Ashton Jeanty led all running backs through the late window on Sunday . he rushed for 138 yards and a touchdown on 21 carries, plus he added two receptions for 17 yards . the rookie could see a bump in pass game usage after his production .

title: Best of NFL Week 4's arrivals, featuring Jonathan Taylor's guitar
content: the Indianapolis Colts running back paid homage to the late owner, Jim Irsay . he carried a guitar with the vinyl "Play for Jim" featured on it . there goes 87  pic.twitter.com/ednfGYcIP0 There goes 86 .
